newsitem.title: USA: Nashville sees $25 mln from Colo. project.
newsitem.headline: Nashville sees $25 mln from Colo. project.

text.p: Nashville Country Club Inc said on Monday that based on preliminary estimates, it expected proceeds of over $25 million over the next four to six years from the development of its year-round resort in the Colorado Rockies.

On August 5, the company signed an agreement principle with East West Partners, a Colorado resort development company, to carry out an estimated $75 million project to enhance its Village of Breckenridge, a 16-acre complex in Breckenridge, Colo.

Under the agreement, East West and Nashville Country each made initial capital contributions of $100,000 to the joint venture, to fund pre-development costs, including architectural and economic modeling, the company said.

Nashville said phase one of the project was nearing completion and was expected to end during the first half of 1997. Nashville also planned to sell undeveloped land and certain commercial space to the joint venture, to facilitate the development and redevelopment.

The Village at Breckenridge complex includes two hotels, management of 250 condominiums and homes, 32,000 square feet of meeting space, 11 restaurants and bars, and 85,000 square feet of retail space.
